@graph.headline: So, Shopify is Mad About Your Cloudflare Proxy? Here's How to Fix It.
@graph.description: Learn how to fix the Shopify error 'Your domain has a Cloudflare proxy, which is not supported by Shopify' by disabling the proxy in your Cloudflare DNS settings.

@graph.name: How to Fix the Cloudflare Proxy Error in Shopify
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to disable Cloudflare proxy for Shopify domain connection

step.name: Access Cloudflare DNS Settings
step.text: Log in to Cloudflare, click your domain, and navigate to the DNS section

step.name: Disable Proxy for A Record
step.text: Find the A record pointing to 23.227.38.65 and click the orange cloud to turn it grey (DNS Only)

step.name: Disable Proxy for WWW CNAME Record
step.text: Find the www CNAME record pointing to shops.myshopify.com and turn the orange cloud grey

step.name: Verify Connection in Shopify
step.text: Return to Shopify admin, go to Settings > Domains, and click 'Verify connection'

mainEntity.name: Wait, but doesn't Shopify use Cloudflare itself? This is confusing.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it does! Shopify uses a special, high-end enterprise version of Cloudflare that's built right into its platform. When you run your domain through your own free, personal Cloudflare account with the proxy on, you're creating a conflict with their built-in system. You need to let traffic go directly to Shopify's network so their system can work right.

mainEntity.name: What's the one setting that causes all the trouble?

acceptedAnswer.text: The proxy setting. The orange cloud. That's it. It's the root of all evil in this specific scenario. You have to change it to 'DNS Only,' which is the grey cloud, so your domain connects properly.

mainEntity.name: How do I fix this again, real quick?

acceptedAnswer.text: Log into Cloudflare. Go to DNS. Find the A record and the www CNAME record. Click the orange cloud next to each one to make it turn grey. Go back to Shopify and click 'Verify connection.' Done.

@graph.name: Three Key Conflicts Between Shopify and Cloudflare Proxy

itemListElement.name: Domain Verification Conflict
itemListElement.description: Shopify needs to verify domain ownership by checking if A record points directly to IP 23.227.38.65, but Cloudflare proxy hides the real IP

itemListElement.name: SSL Certificate Management Conflict
itemListElement.description: Shopify needs direct domain connection to install and renew SSL certificates, but proxy blocks this process

itemListElement.name: CDN Double-Caching Conflict
itemListElement.description: Using Cloudflare CDN with Shopify's built-in CDN creates redundant caching that can show outdated content
